I am a fairly new user to Cantera, and have run a few scripts in
python.  I=
 am currently working with npflame1.py.  I have successfully
run the latest=
 version from the CVS repository (C2H6/air) with no
issues.  

When I attem=
pt to change the fuel or oxidizer content, I am having a
few issues:  

Fir=
st, I have to work with grid refinement to get a reasonable result
(with su=
fficient data points) with any change.  This is not really an
issue, just l=
ooking for any input on method/approach with the grid
parameters.  

Second=
, I am getting erroneous result for the temperature profile in
that it stay=
s at a constant 300K across the solution space.  In the
original version, t=
he solution gives an appropriate result with
temperature increasing towards=
 the center of the solution space, where
the flame exists.  

I have tried =
running with CH4, and tried with a diluted fuel mixture
(C2H6 and N2, etc).=
  Both result in the erroneous temperature profile.

I would appreciate any=
 assistance.


Thanks, Michael
